## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(exscidata)
data("hypertrophy")

glimpse(hypertrophy) ## for å få en oversikt over datasettet

?hypertrophy ## for å se en beskrivelse av alle kategorier.

hypertrophy %>% 
  mutate(VL_change = VL_T4 - VL_T1) %>% 
  select(PARTICIPANT, VL_change) %>% 
  print()

dat <- hypertrophy %>%
  select(PARTICIPANT, SQUAT_VOLUME, VL_T4, VL_T1) %>%
  mutate(VL_change = VL_T4/VL_T1) %>% 
  print()

mod <- lm(VL_change ~ SQUAT_VOLUME, data = dat)

plot(mod)

summary(mod)

dat %>% 
  ggplot(aes(SQUAT_VOLUME, VL_change)) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  geom_point()
```
